SEARCH
Module io.github.ascopes.jct
Package io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers

Class FileManagerBuilder

java.lang.Object
io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers.FileManagerBuilder
@API(since="0.0.1", status=EXPERIMENTAL) public final class FileManagerBuilder extends Object
A template for creating a file manager later.

File manager creation is deferred until as late as possible as to enable the specification of the version to use when opening JARs that may be multi-release compatible. We have to do this to ensure the behaviour for opening JARs matches the release version the code is compiled against.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Ashley Scopes

    • addPath

      public void addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, PathWrapper path)
      Add a path to a package.
      Parameters:
      location - the location the package resides within.
      path - the path to associate with the location.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is module-oriented or output oriented.

    • addPath

      public void addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, String module, PathWrapper path)
      Add a path to a module.
      Parameters:
      location - the location the module resides within.
      module - the name of the module to add.
      path - the path to associate with the module.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location parameter is a ModuleLocation.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location parameter is not module-oriented.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the module parameter is not a valid module name, as defined by the Java Language Specification for the current JVM.

    • isFixJvmModulePathMismatch

      public boolean isFixJvmModulePathMismatch()
      Get whether we will attempt to fix modules appearing on the classpath, or non-modules appearing on the module path.

      This enables correct classpath and module path detection when the test pack is a module but the code being compiled in the test is not, and vice versa. We need this because many build systems decide whether to populate the --module-path flat or the --classpath with JPMS-enabled dependencies based on whether the project under compilation is a JPMS module itself.

      This only applies if isInheritModulePath() or isInheritClassPath() is enabled, and only applies to the current JVM classpath and module path.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to JctCompiler.DEFAULT_FIX_JVM_MODULEPATH_MISMATCH.

      Returns:
      true if enabled, or false if disabled.

    • setFixJvmModulePathMismatch

      public void setFixJvmModulePathMismatch(boolean fixJvmModulePathMismatch)
      Get whether we will attempt to fix modules appearing on the classpath, or non-modules appearing on the module path.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to JctCompiler.DEFAULT_FIX_JVM_MODULEPATH_MISMATCH.

      Parameters:
      fixJvmModulePathMismatch - whether to enable the mismatch fixing or not.

    • isInheritClassPath

      public boolean isInheritClassPath()
      Get whether the class path is inherited from the caller JVM or not.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to JctCompiler.DEFAULT_INHERIT_CLASS_PATH.

      Returns:
      whether the current class path is being inherited or not.

    • inheritClassPath

      public void inheritClassPath(boolean inheritClassPath)
      Set whether the class path is inherited from the caller JVM or not.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to JctCompiler.DEFAULT_INHERIT_CLASS_PATH.

      Parameters:
      inheritClassPath - true to include it, or false to exclude it.

      Parameters:
      inheritModulePath - true to include it, or false to exclude it.

    • isInheritPlatformClassPath

      public boolean isInheritPlatformClassPath()
      Get whether the current platform class path is being inherited from the caller JVM or not.

      This may also be known as the "bootstrap class path".

      Default environments probably will not provide this functionality, in which case it will be ignored.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to JctCompiler.DEFAULT_INHERIT_PLATFORM_CLASS_PATH.

      Returns:
      whether the platform class path is being inherited or not.

    • inheritPlatformClassPath

      public void inheritPlatformClassPath(boolean inheritPlatformClassPath)
      Set whether the current platform class path is being inherited from the caller JVM or not.

      This may also be known as the "bootstrap class path".

      Default environments probably will not provide this functionality, in which case it will be ignored.

      Parameters:
      inheritPlatformClassPath - true to include it, or false to exclude it.

    • isInheritSystemModulePath

      public boolean isInheritSystemModulePath()

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to JctCompiler.DEFAULT_INHERIT_SYSTEM_MODULE_PATH.

      Returns:
      whether the system module path is being inherited or not.
